title.narrative: Supporting Peace through Natural Resource Management in Burma's Ethnic Regions (P-NRM) - INRM

description.narrative:
Project Goal: Support Burma’s democratic transition by addressing natural resource conflicts in southern Shan and Chin States.
Activities: (1) Strengthen the ability of key leaders in Chin and Southern Shan to resolve concrete natural resource disputes that are fueling tensions and could derail Burma’s democratic opening, (2) improve the capacity of local organizations and governments to implements natural resource management projects that support negotiated agreements, and (3) strengthen the ability of local governments to implement initiatives that address natural resource tensions.

Supporting Peace through Natural Resource Management in Burma's Ethnic Regions focuses on the fact that the heart of violence between ethnic minorities and central governments is the control of natural resources. This program will take advantage of recent political developments and ceasefires holding in several regions to carry out activities that mitigate conflict and promote reconciliation by bringing together individuals of different ethnic, religious or political backgrounds.
